committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Asian and Pacific Affairs
Subcommittee on Human Rights and International Organizations

official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the United States should not provide security and economic assistance to the Philippines if President Ferdinand Marcos of the Philippines reimposes martial law and does not make significant progress toward restoring democracy and insuring human rights in the Philippines.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that security and economic assistance to the Philippines should be suspended if: (1) President Ferdinand Marcos reimposes martial law; or (2) progress is not made to restore democracy (including, but not limited to, freedom of the press, freedom of speech, and the scheduling of free and open elections); and (3) progress is not made to insure the human rights of the Filipinos.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the United States should not provide security and economic assistance to the Philippines if President Ferdinand Marcos of the Philippines reimposes martial law and does not make significant progress toward restoring democracy and insuring human rights in the Philippines.
